title: Viewers of Britain's Got Talent left sobbing watching sand artist create tribute to Princess Diana
text:
A sand artist left audiences in tears last night after retelling the story of Princess Diana on the Britain's Got Talent: The Champions finale.

Kseniya Simonova, 34, from Ukraine, wowed viewers of the talent show last night after creating a series of animations in a tray of sand about the late royal's life.

The Ukranian sand artist drew Princess Diana on her wedding day in London, and created Prince William, 37, and Prince Harry, 35, before drawing a candle to represent the royal's death.

Many of those watching said they were in floods of tears over the tribute, with one writing: 'Wow I was so emotional watching her performance.'

Viewers of Britain's Got Talent: The Champions were left in tears last night after sand artist Kseniya Simonova paid tribute to the life of Princess Diana (above)

Kseniya drew the late royal performing royal duties, as well as cuddling her two sons Prince William, 37, and Prince Harry, 35

Many took to Twitter to praise the sand artist, admitting they were left feeling emotional over the 'beautiful tribute'

They added: 'Such a beautiful tribute to late Princess Diana of Wales and brought back a lot of memories.'

Another wrote: 'Owns emotional when Princess Diana was with young Harry and William.'

The tribute saw Ukranian artist Kseniya Simonova dedicate her Final sand and snow story to Princess Diana.

The story included scenes from the royal's wedding day, before she held Prince Harry and William in her arms.

As part of her tribute, Kseniya drew Princess Diana holding her two sons, Prince William and Prince Harry (pictured above)

The sand artist stunned the judges and audiences with her incredible tribute to the late royal durinng the programme last night

Kseniya creates her artwork by drawing scenes in sand, which is then projected onto a large screen behind her

Kseniya also drew Diana visiting hospitals and hospices as part of her royal duties.

Audiences were left in tears when she completed her sand story by drawing a candle 'blowing in the wind', before stepping over to a 'snow' area and writing: 'Always in our hearts'.

Many took to Twitter to praise the artist for her creation, with one commenting: 'That tribute to Princess Diana was lovely.'

Another wrote: 'So I've not watched a single episode of #BGT but we're watching on catch up and me and my dad are sobbing at this lady doing the Princess Diana out of sand.'

She finished her tribute to the royal by drawing Princess Diana in salt, and writing 'Always in our hearts'

Kseniya's story left viewers in tears, as they praised the sand artist for her 'beautiful' tribute to the late royal

Another wrote: 'That was beautiful, she's such a talented artist. I was literally in tears watching that. Such a touching tribute.'

One commented: 'That is real talent. She has to win! Her tribute was beautiful. We miss Princess Diana. Thanks for thinking of her.'

Kseniya's performance also impressed the judges on the programme, with Amanda Holden calling the tribute 'so clever'.

The sand artist came third in the talent competition last night, with dance duo Twist and Pulse landing the top spot and crown.
description: Kseniya Simonova, 34, from Ukraine, left viewers in tears last night after retelling the story of Princess Diana's life during her finale act for Britain's Got Talent: The Champions.
